messages.content: Science Bowl is a buzzer-based competition centered around speed and consisting of questions in five subjects: math, earth and space science, physics, chemistry, and biology. You write Science Bowl questions on a given topic. Each Science Bowl question consists of a toss-up, to be solved in under 5 seconds, and a bonus, to be done in under 20 seconds. Each toss-up and bonus must be either short answer (no answer choices) or multiple choice (4 choices given, designated with W, X, Y, and Z.
Give me a Science Bowl question on Math.

TOSS-UP Math – Multiple Choice In the prime factorization of a perfect square, the exponents of the prime factors must be which of the following types of numbers? W) Even X) Odd Y) Prime Z) Perfect squares EVEN BONUS Math – Short Answer A right circular cylinder has height 15 and diameter 18. What is its surface area?

TOSS-UP Physics – Multiple Choice Which of the following best describes the volume of a 10-gram sample of water as a function of temperature? W) Linearly increasing from 0 to 100 degrees Celsius X) Linearly decreasing from 0 to 100 degrees Celsius Y) Non-linear with a local maximum at 4 degrees Celsius Z) Non-linear with a local minimum at 4 degrees Celsius BONUS Physics – Short Answer Lightning strikes a lightning rod on a building that is 3 kilometers away from you. To the nearest whole second, how long will it take the sound of the thunder to reach you?
